Headline: Must-watch videos of the week
Article_Body: A game show gaffe leads to free food, a cat beats the odds, and a couple of close calls. Here are the must-watch videos of the week. Fast escape to safety Students at a North Carolina school got an extra workout, running away as a storm destroyed a wall of their gym. Three students were taken to the hospital and released. Another close call Pedestrians in Washington got a scare as a wall tumbled over just after they passed it. A firetruck with impeccable timing assisted right away, and emergency crews confirmed no one was trapped. Winning for losing A contestant on "Family Feud Canada" hit the jackpot after incorrectly guessing Popeye's favorite food. The host meant the cartoon character, not the chicken franchise. All ended well when the restaurant chain offered the game show player $10,000 worth of free food. Cat-astrophe avoided  A California cat named Max showed its warrior spirit after fending off a trio of coyotes in its yard. Max's owner said this feline will be a strictly indoor cat from now on to prevent it from becoming a predator's dinner. Self-portraits, 21st-century style Think the art of taking selfies is a recent phenomenon? Guess again. One photographer has been taking pictures of himself almost every day since January 2000. He said he will continue to release updates every 10 years for the rest of his life.
